bibl.title: Letter from Fitzhugh Lee to Walter Reed, September 27, 1898

div1.p: Lee presents Reed with a corps badge for sanitary inspection services.

div1.head: Letter from Fitzhugh Lee to Walter Reed, September 27, 1898
div1.opener:
L.S.3C2
HEADQUARTERS SEVENTH ARMY CORPS.
OFFICE OF ADJUTANT GENERAL.
CAMP CUBA LIBRE.
Jacksonville, Fla.September 27th, 1898.
Major Walter Reed,
Medical Department U.S. Army,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Major:-
div1.p:
Appreciating the arduous services performed by you as
Sanitary Inspector, and your valuable recommendations for the improve-
ment of the sanitary conditions of this Corps, together with your able
suggestions relative to sanitary measures, it affords me great pleasure
to authorize the Chief Surgeon of my Corps to present you with the Corps
badge, which I hope you will take pleasure in wearing.

closer.signed:
Fitzhugh Lee
Major-General U.S. Volunteers,
Commanding Seventh Corps.
